2203.subject: HDEV
2203.descrlong:
Parenting across the Lifespan examines the significant impact of parents with regard to children's development and life potential. Students will explore parenting as an evolving process that changes and reflects the developing individual's and adult's current life-stage.   Grand parenting and parenting of adult children are also included.  Diversity in parenting, theories, and programs will be analyzed in the context of discovering and building on parenting strengths.  (May be offered as classroom-based, hybrid, or online.) (Credit/No Credit Available)

(Prereq: Junior or Senior Standing)
